item.title: Welcome to one137
item.description: This is my repository of thoughts and learnings. A small subset of what I write in my Obsidian vault gets published here. At the moment, all the published content is about my Homelab: a self-hosting experiment to enjoy the IT services I need – for free and with full control – and, more importantly, to hack around and learn about IT infrastructure and related topics.

item.title: Forward Proxy
item.description: A forward proxy sits between users and the internet, acting as an intermediary for outbound requests. When users want to access external websites, their traffic goes through the forward proxy first.

item.title: Reverse Proxy
item.description: A reverse proxy is a server that sits in front of internal services (such as web servers) and forwards client requests (e.g. from the internet) to them.

item.title: TrueNAS
item.description: TrueNAS Scale is a network-attached storage (NAS) product produced by iXsystems. Based on the Open ZFS file system, it runs on Linux and is compatible with virtualization hosts such as Proxmox.
